name: encounter_id
description: The "encounter_id" field uniquely identifies an encounter within a healthcare system. It is crucial for linking related data across different systems and ensuring continuity of care. This identifier is typically assigned by the healthcare provider's system and is used to track the patient's interactions with healthcare services. It is essential for data integration, reporting, and analytics, allowing for accurate retrieval and association of encounter-related information.

name: lastupdated
description: The "lastupdated" field indicates the most recent date and time when the encounter record was modified. This timestamp is vital for data synchronization and version control, ensuring that the most current information is available for clinical decision-making and reporting. It helps in tracking changes over time and is essential for maintaining data integrity and consistency across systems.

name: hl7_message_date_time
description: The "hl7_message_date_time" field represents the date and time when the HL7 message related to the encounter was generated. This field is important for understanding the timing of data exchange and ensuring that messages are processed in the correct sequence. It aids in troubleshooting data flow issues and verifying the timeliness of information sharing between systems.

name: hl7_message_date_time_UTC
description: The "hl7_message_date_time_UTC" field provides the date and time of the HL7 message in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). This standardization is crucial for interoperability, allowing systems in different time zones to accurately interpret the timing of messages. It ensures consistency in data exchange and helps in coordinating care across regions.

name: hl7_message_control_id
description: The "hl7_message_control_id" field is a unique identifier for an HL7 message, used to track and manage message exchanges. It is essential for ensuring message integrity and preventing duplication or loss of data during transmission. This control ID helps in auditing and troubleshooting message flow, providing a reference point for message acknowledgment and error handling.

name: meta_latest_source_date_time
description: The "meta_latest_source_date_time" field indicates the most recent date and time when the source data for the encounter was updated. This field is important for data provenance, helping to trace the origin and currency of the information. It ensures that the data used for clinical and operational purposes is up-to-date and reliable.

name: intermediate_snapshot_creation_date_time
description: The "intermediate_snapshot_creation_date_time" field marks the date and time when an intermediate snapshot of the encounter data was created. This snapshot is used for data processing and transformation, ensuring that changes are captured and managed effectively. It is crucial for maintaining data accuracy and supporting incremental updates in complex data workflows.

name: final_fhir_write_date_time
description: The "final_fhir_write_date_time" field represents the date and time when the encounter data was last written to the FHIR server. This timestamp is important for ensuring that the most recent data is available for clinical use and interoperability. It helps in tracking data updates and ensuring that the FHIR resource reflects the latest information.

name: final_fhir_commit_date_time
description: The "final_fhir_commit_date_time" field indicates the date and time when the encounter data was committed to the FHIR server. This timestamp is crucial for data integrity, ensuring that changes are finalized and available for use. It supports audit trails and helps in verifying the completion of data transactions in the FHIR ecosystem.

name: encounter_version_id
description: The "encounter_version_id" field is a unique identifier for a specific version of an encounter record. It is essential for version control, allowing systems to track changes and manage different iterations of the encounter data. This field supports data reconciliation and ensures that users have access to the correct version of the information for clinical and operational purposes.

name: version_id_fingerprint
description: The 'version_id_fingerprint' field is a unique identifier used to track the version of the FHIR resource. It ensures data integrity and consistency by allowing systems to detect changes or updates to the resource. This is crucial for maintaining accurate and up-to-date patient records across different systems. In FHIR, versioning is an essential aspect of resource management, enabling traceability and auditability of changes over time.

name: consent_coid
description: The 'consent_coid' field represents a unique identifier for a consent directive associated with the encounter. It is used to link the encounter to specific patient consent records, ensuring that data sharing and access comply with patient preferences and legal requirements. This field is vital for maintaining patient privacy and adhering to consent management protocols in healthcare settings.

name: meta_action_code
description: The 'meta_action_code' field indicates the type of action performed on the FHIR resource, such as create, update, or delete. It is part of the resource's metadata and is crucial for understanding the lifecycle of the resource. This field helps in tracking changes and managing resource states, ensuring that systems can accurately process and respond to resource modifications.

name: hl7_v2_source_interface
description: The 'hl7_v2_source_interface' field identifies the source interface from which the HL7 v2 message originated. This is important for interoperability and data integration, as it helps systems trace the origin of data and ensure accurate mapping between HL7 v2 and FHIR resources. Understanding the source interface is key to maintaining data consistency and reliability across different healthcare systems.

name: patient_account_num
description: The 'patient_account_num' field is a unique identifier assigned to a patient's account within a healthcare facility. It is used for billing, administrative, and financial purposes, linking encounters to the patient's financial records. This field is essential for managing patient accounts, ensuring accurate billing, and facilitating communication between clinical and financial systems.

name: patient_primary_id
description: The 'patient_primary_id' field represents the primary identifier for a patient within a healthcare system. It is crucial for uniquely identifying patients and linking their medical records across different encounters and services. This field ensures that patient data is accurately associated with the correct individual, supporting continuity of care and reducing the risk of errors in patient identification.

name: network_mnemonic
description: The 'network_mnemonic' field is a shorthand identifier for the healthcare network or system associated with the encounter. It facilitates the organization and categorization of encounters within larger healthcare networks, aiding in data management and reporting. This field is important for understanding the context of care delivery and ensuring that encounters are correctly attributed to the appropriate network.

name: medical_record_num
description: The 'medical_record_num' field is a unique identifier for a patient's medical record within a healthcare facility. It is used to access and manage the patient's clinical information, ensuring that healthcare providers have accurate and complete data for decision-making. This field is fundamental for maintaining continuity of care, supporting clinical documentation, and facilitating information exchange across systems.

name: coid
description: The 'coid' field represents a unique identifier for a clinical object or entity within the healthcare system. It is used to link encounters to specific clinical objects, such as orders, observations, or procedures. This field is important for ensuring that clinical data is accurately associated with the relevant encounters, supporting comprehensive clinical documentation and analysis.

name: facility_mnemonic
description: The 'facility_mnemonic' field is a shorthand identifier for the healthcare facility where the encounter took place. It is used to categorize and organize encounters by location, aiding in data management and reporting. This field is essential for understanding the context of care delivery, supporting operational efficiency, and ensuring that encounters are correctly attributed to the appropriate facility.

name: fhir_visit_status
description: The "fhir_visit_status" field in a FHIR Encounter resource indicates the current status of the encounter, such as planned, in-progress, or completed. This status is crucial for understanding the stage of the patient's interaction with the healthcare system. It helps in workflow management, resource allocation, and clinical decision-making. Accurate status tracking ensures effective communication among healthcare providers and supports operational efficiency.

name: fhir_patient_class_code
description: The "fhir_patient_class_code" field represents a coded value that categorizes the patient class, such as inpatient, outpatient, or emergency. This classification is essential for determining the type of care provided, resource allocation, and billing processes. It aids in understanding the patient's care setting and is used for reporting and analytics purposes.

name: fhir_patient_class_display
description: The "fhir_patient_class_display" field provides a human-readable representation of the patient class code, such as 'Inpatient' or 'Outpatient'. This display value is used in user interfaces and reports to enhance readability and comprehension. It ensures that healthcare providers and administrative staff can easily interpret the patient class without needing to reference code systems.

name: patient_type
description: The "patient_type" field categorizes the patient based on specific criteria, such as new or established patient, or based on the care setting. This classification is important for clinical workflows, resource planning, and billing. It helps in identifying the nature of the patient's interaction with the healthcare system and supports operational and financial processes.

name: admission_type
description: The "admission_type" field indicates the nature of the patient's admission, such as elective, emergency, or urgent. This information is critical for prioritizing care, resource allocation, and understanding the context of the encounter. It plays a role in clinical decision-making, operational planning, and financial management, ensuring appropriate care delivery and reimbursement.

name: patient_class_code
description: The "patient_class_code" field is a coded representation of the patient's class, similar to "fhir_patient_class_code", and is used to categorize the patient as inpatient, outpatient, etc. This code is vital for care delivery, billing, and reporting. It helps in understanding the care setting and is used in various administrative and clinical processes.

name: account_status_code
description: The "account_status_code" field represents the current status of the patient's account, such as active, closed, or delinquent. This status is important for financial management, billing, and collections. It helps in tracking the financial aspects of the patient's care and ensures accurate and timely processing of payments and reimbursements.

name: vip_indicator_code
description: The "vip_indicator_code" field is used to identify patients who are considered VIPs (Very Important Persons) and may require special handling or accommodations. This code is important for ensuring that VIP patients receive the appropriate level of attention and service. It helps in managing patient expectations and maintaining high standards of care and service.

name: financial_class_code
description: The "financial_class_code" field categorizes the patient's financial responsibility or insurance coverage, such as self-pay, Medicare, or private insurance. This classification is crucial for billing, reimbursement, and financial planning. It helps in understanding the patient's payment obligations and ensures accurate processing of claims and payments.

name: mode_of_arrival_code
description: The "mode_of_arrival_code" field indicates how the patient arrived at the healthcare facility, such as by ambulance, walk-in, or referral. This information is important for understanding the context of the encounter, resource allocation, and operational planning. It helps in assessing the urgency of the patient's condition and ensuring appropriate care delivery.

name: accommodation_code
description: The "accommodation_code" field in a FHIR Encounter resource represents the specific type of accommodation provided to the patient during the encounter. This can include various types of hospital rooms or wards. It is crucial for resource allocation, billing, and understanding the level of care provided. The code is typically drawn from a standardized code system to ensure consistency across healthcare systems.

name: accommodation_code_category
description: The "accommodation_code_category" field categorizes the type of accommodation provided during an encounter. It provides a higher-level classification than the specific accommodation code, helping in reporting and analysis of resource utilization. This categorization aids in understanding the general type of care environment, such as inpatient, outpatient, or emergency.

name: hospital_service_type_code
description: The "hospital_service_type_code" field identifies the specific type of service provided during the encounter, such as surgery, radiology, or cardiology. This code is essential for clinical documentation, billing, and resource management. It helps in categorizing encounters based on the services rendered, facilitating operational and financial analysis.

name: hospital_service_type_text
description: The "hospital_service_type_text" field provides a human-readable description of the service type code associated with the encounter. This text is useful for clinicians and administrative staff to quickly understand the nature of services provided without needing to reference code systems. It enhances clarity in clinical documentation and communication.

name: admit_source_code
description: The "admit_source_code" field indicates the source from which the patient was admitted to the healthcare facility, such as a physician referral, emergency room, or transfer from another facility. This information is vital for understanding patient flow, resource allocation, and for certain billing processes. It helps in analyzing patterns of patient admissions.

name: discharge_disposition
description: The "discharge_disposition" field in a FHIR Encounter resource describes the patient's status and destination upon discharge, such as home, another healthcare facility, or deceased. It is crucial for care continuity, resource planning, and quality reporting. This field can have multiple entries to capture complex discharge scenarios.

name: code
description: The "code" field within "discharge_disposition" specifies the standardized code representing the discharge status. This code is essential for interoperability, allowing consistent interpretation across different systems. It is typically sourced from a recognized code system, ensuring uniformity in discharge documentation.

name: display
description: The "display" field within "discharge_disposition" provides a human-readable description of the discharge code. This text aids healthcare providers and administrative staff in understanding the discharge status without needing to interpret codes, enhancing communication and documentation clarity.

name: patient_id
description: The "patient_id" field uniquely identifies the patient associated with the encounter. It is a critical element for linking encounters to patient records, ensuring accurate patient tracking, and maintaining continuity of care. This identifier is typically unique within a healthcare system, facilitating interoperability and data exchange.

name: appointment_id
description: The "appointment_id" field links the encounter to a specific appointment, if applicable. This connection is important for tracking patient appointments, managing schedules, and analyzing appointment-related metrics. It helps in understanding the context of the encounter and ensuring that care delivery aligns with scheduled appointments.

name: account_id
description: The "account_id" field associates the encounter with a specific financial account, facilitating billing and financial management. This identifier is crucial for tracking charges, payments, and financial transactions related to the encounter. It ensures accurate financial documentation and supports revenue cycle management.

name: deceased_date_time
description: The "deceased_date_time" field records the date and time of a patient's death, if applicable, during the encounter. This information is vital for clinical documentation, legal reporting, and quality improvement initiatives. It is typically represented as a date-time string, including time zone, to ensure precision and accuracy.

name: admission_date
description: The "admission_date" field in a FHIR Encounter resource represents the date and time when a patient is formally admitted to a healthcare facility. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically represented as a dateTime data type in FHIR, which includes date and time with time zone. Clinical Significance: Marks the start of the encounter, crucial for determining the duration and for clinical and operational purposes. Billing and Reimbursement: Essential for accurate billing and reimbursement calculations. Clinical Documentation: Used to document the patient's admission time for continuity of care and medical record keeping. Quality Improvement: Can be used to analyze admission patterns and improve patient flow. Relationship to Encounter Period: The "admission_date" is closely related to the period element of the Encounter resource, which defines the overall timeframe of the encounter. Special Considerations: Accuracy is critical for data quality and clinical decision-making.

name: discharge_date
description: The "discharge_date" field in a FHIR Encounter resource represents the date and time when the patient was officially discharged from the encounter. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically represented as an instant data type in FHIR, which is a date and time with time zone. Clinical Significance: Marks the end of the encounter, crucial for determining the duration and for various clinical and operational purposes. Billing and Reimbursement: Essential for accurate billing and reimbursement calculations. Clinical Documentation: Used to document the patient's discharge time for continuity of care and medical record keeping. Quality Improvement: Can be used to analyze length of stay, identify potential delays, and improve patient flow. Relationship to Encounter Period: The "discharge_date" is closely related to the period element of the Encounter resource, which defines the overall timeframe of the encounter. Special Considerations: Not always applicable for some encounter types.

name: is_valid_date_ind
description: The "is_valid_date_ind" field indicates whether the associated date fields (e.g., admission_date, discharge_date) are valid and conform to expected formats and logical constraints. Key Considerations: Data Type: Boolean, representing true or false. Clinical Significance: Ensures data integrity and reliability, crucial for clinical decision-making and operational processes. Data Quality: Helps identify and flag potential data entry errors or inconsistencies. System Interoperability: Facilitates data exchange between systems by ensuring date validity. Special Considerations: May require additional validation logic to determine the validity of complex date scenarios. In Summary: The "is_valid_date_ind" field is a critical component for maintaining the accuracy and reliability of date-related information within the FHIR Encounter resource.

name: alt_admission_date_time
description: The "alt_admission_date_time" field provides an alternative representation of the admission date and time, potentially used for specific system requirements or legacy data compatibility. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically a string representing date and time. Clinical Significance: Offers flexibility in data representation, ensuring compatibility with various systems and standards. Data Integration: Facilitates integration with systems that may use different date-time formats. Special Considerations: Ensure consistency with the primary "admission_date" field to avoid discrepancies. In Summary: The "alt_admission_date_time" field supports interoperability and data integration by providing an alternative format for admission date and time information.

name: hl7_admission_date_time
description: The "hl7_admission_date_time" field captures the admission date and time in a format compliant with HL7 standards, ensuring interoperability across healthcare systems. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically a string formatted according to HL7 specifications. Clinical Significance: Ensures consistent data exchange between HL7-compliant systems. Data Integration: Facilitates seamless integration and communication across diverse healthcare IT environments. Special Considerations: Ensure alignment with the primary "admission_date" field to maintain data consistency. In Summary: The "hl7_admission_date_time" field is essential for maintaining interoperability and data consistency in HL7-compliant healthcare systems.

name: alt_discharge_date_time
description: The "alt_discharge_date_time" field provides an alternative representation of the discharge date and time, potentially used for specific system requirements or legacy data compatibility. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically a string representing date and time. Clinical Significance: Offers flexibility in data representation, ensuring compatibility with various systems and standards. Data Integration: Facilitates integration with systems that may use different date-time formats. Special Considerations: Ensure consistency with the primary "discharge_date" field to avoid discrepancies. In Summary: The "alt_discharge_date_time" field supports interoperability and data integration by providing an alternative format for discharge date and time information.

name: hl7_discharge_date_time
description: The "hl7_discharge_date_time" field captures the discharge date and time in a format compliant with HL7 standards, ensuring interoperability across healthcare systems. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically a string formatted according to HL7 specifications. Clinical Significance: Ensures consistent data exchange between HL7-compliant systems. Data Integration: Facilitates seamless integration and communication across diverse healthcare IT environments. Special Considerations: Ensure alignment with the primary "discharge_date" field to maintain data consistency. In Summary: The "hl7_discharge_date_time" field is essential for maintaining interoperability and data consistency in HL7-compliant healthcare systems.

name: reason_for_visit_text
description: The "reason_for_visit_text" field captures the patient's stated reason for seeking medical care, typically in free-text format. Key Considerations: Data Type: String, allowing for narrative description. Clinical Significance: Provides context for the encounter, aiding in diagnosis and treatment planning. Patient Communication: Reflects the patient's perspective and concerns, enhancing patient-centered care. Data Analysis: Useful for identifying common reasons for visits and trends in healthcare utilization. Special Considerations: May require standardization or mapping to structured codes for interoperability. In Summary: The "reason_for_visit_text" field is crucial for understanding the patient's perspective and guiding clinical decision-making during the encounter.

name: mt_reason_for_visit_code
description: The "mt_reason_for_visit_code" field represents a coded version of the reason for visit, typically using standardized medical terminologies. Key Considerations: Data Type: String, representing a code from a standardized terminology system. Clinical Significance: Facilitates structured data capture and interoperability across systems. Data Analysis: Enables aggregation and analysis of visit reasons for quality improvement and research. Coding Standards: May use terminologies like SNOMED CT or ICD for consistency. Special Considerations: Ensure accurate mapping from free-text descriptions to standardized codes. In Summary: The "mt_reason_for_visit_code" field enhances data interoperability and analysis by providing a standardized representation of the reason for visit.

name: patient_location
description: The "patient_location" field captures information about the patient's physical location(s) during the encounter, supporting operational and clinical workflows. Key Considerations: Data Type: Repeated record, allowing multiple locations to be documented. Clinical Significance: Essential for tracking patient movement and resource utilization within a facility. Operational Efficiency: Supports bed management and patient flow optimization. Data Integration: Facilitates interoperability by providing structured location data. Special Considerations: Ensure accurate and timely updates to reflect real-time patient location changes. In Summary: The "patient_location" field is vital for managing patient logistics and optimizing healthcare delivery during an encounter.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The "location_id" field uniquely identifies a specific location within a healthcare facility, such as a ward or room. Key Considerations: Data Type: String, representing a unique identifier. Clinical Significance: Supports accurate tracking of patient location and resource allocation. Operational Efficiency: Facilitates bed management and patient flow optimization. Data Integration: Ensures interoperability by providing a consistent identifier for locations. Special Considerations: Ensure consistency and uniqueness of location identifiers across systems. In Summary: The "location_id" field is crucial for accurately identifying and managing patient locations within a healthcare facility.

fields.name: mnemonic
fields.description: The "mnemonic" field provides a shorthand or abbreviated representation of a location, often used for quick reference in clinical and operational settings. Key Considerations: Data Type: String, representing an abbreviated location name. Clinical Significance: Facilitates quick identification and communication of patient locations. Operational Efficiency: Supports streamlined workflows and communication among healthcare staff. Data Integration: May require mapping to full location identifiers for interoperability. Special Considerations: Ensure clarity and consistency of mnemonics to avoid confusion. In Summary: The "mnemonic" field aids in efficient communication and workflow management by providing a concise representation of patient locations.

fields.name: physical_type
fields.description: The "physical_type" field describes the type of physical location, such as a room, bed, or ward, providing context for the patient's location during the encounter. Key Considerations: Data Type: String, representing the type of location. Clinical Significance: Provides context for patient care and resource allocation. Operational Efficiency: Supports bed management and patient flow optimization. Data Integration: Facilitates interoperability by providing structured location type information. Special Considerations: Ensure accurate classification of location types to support clinical and operational needs. In Summary: The "physical_type" field is essential for understanding the context and logistics of patient care within a healthcare facility.

name: emergency_department
description: The 'emergency_department' field represents a structured record of a patient's encounter in the emergency department. It includes various subfields that capture critical timestamps, priorities, reasons for visit, and other relevant details of the encounter.

fields.name: edm_arrived_date_time
fields.description: The 'edm_arrived_date_time' field captures the exact date and time when the patient arrived at the emergency department. This timestamp is crucial for tracking the patient's journey through the healthcare system, assessing wait times, and initiating the encounter period.

fields.name: edm_triaged_date_time
fields.description: The 'edm_triaged_date_time' field records the date and time when the patient was triaged in the emergency department. Triage is a critical process that determines the priority of patients' treatments based on the severity of their condition.

fields.name: edm_departure_date_time
fields.description: The 'edm_departure_date_time' field indicates the date and time when the patient departed from the emergency department. This information is essential for calculating the length of stay and for discharge planning and follow-up care.

fields.name: coid
fields.description: The 'coid' field represents a unique identifier for the encounter or case in the emergency department. It is used to track and manage patient records and ensure accurate documentation and retrieval of encounter details.

fields.name: priority_rank
fields.description: The 'priority_rank' field indicates the assigned priority level of the patient's case in the emergency department. It helps in managing patient flow and ensuring that those with the most urgent needs receive timely care.

fields.name: priority_code
fields.description: The 'priority_code' field provides a coded representation of the patient's priority level in the emergency department. This code is used for standardized communication and documentation of triage decisions.

fields.name: priority_text
fields.description: The 'priority_text' field offers a textual description of the patient's priority level in the emergency department. It complements the priority code by providing a human-readable explanation of the triage decision.

fields.name: edm_reason_for_visit_code
fields.description: The 'edm_reason_for_visit_code' field captures a coded representation of the reason for the patient's visit to the emergency department. This code is essential for clinical documentation, billing, and statistical analysis.

fields.name: edm_reason_for_visit_text
fields.description: The 'edm_reason_for_visit_text' field provides a textual description of the reason for the patient's visit to the emergency department. It aids in understanding the patient's presenting complaint and guiding clinical care.

fields.name: departure_info
fields.description: The 'departure_info' field contains detailed information about the patient's departure from the emergency department, including disposition and condition at discharge. It is crucial for continuity of care and discharge planning.

fields.name: departure_disposition_code
fields.description: The 'departure_disposition_code' field provides a coded representation of the patient's disposition upon leaving the emergency department. It is used for standardized documentation and reporting of discharge outcomes.

fields.name: departure_disposition_text
fields.description: The 'departure_disposition_text' field offers a textual description of the patient's disposition upon departure from the emergency department. It complements the disposition code by providing a human-readable explanation.

fields.name: departure_disposition_display
fields.description: The 'departure_disposition_display' field provides a display-friendly version of the patient's disposition upon leaving the emergency department. It is used in user interfaces and reports for easy interpretation.

fields.name: departure_condition_code
fields.description: The 'departure_condition_code' field captures a coded representation of the patient's condition at the time of departure from the emergency department. It is essential for clinical documentation and quality reporting.

fields.name: departure_condition_text
fields.description: The 'departure_condition_text' field provides a textual description of the patient's condition at the time of departure from the emergency department. It aids in understanding the patient's status and guiding follow-up care.

fields.name: departure_condition_display
fields.description: The 'departure_condition_display' field offers a display-friendly version of the patient's condition at the time of departure from the emergency department. It is used in user interfaces and reports for easy interpretation.

fields.name: departure_comments
fields.description: The 'departure_comments' field allows for additional comments or notes regarding the patient's departure from the emergency department. It provides context and details that may not be captured in structured fields.

fields.name: patient_location
fields.description: The 'patient_location' field captures information about the patient's location within the emergency department, including treatment and reserved rooms. It is vital for tracking patient movement and resource allocation.

fields.name: treatment_room
fields.description: The 'treatment_room' field contains details about the room where the patient received treatment in the emergency department. It includes subfields for room code and text, aiding in resource management and patient tracking.

fields.name: room_code
fields.description: The 'room_code' field provides a coded representation of the treatment room assigned to the patient in the emergency department. It is used for efficient room management and patient tracking.

fields.name: room_text
fields.description: The 'room_text' field offers a textual description of the treatment room assigned to the patient in the emergency department. It complements the room code by providing a human-readable explanation.

fields.name: edm_location
fields.description: The 'edm_location' field captures information about the specific location within the emergency department where the patient is situated. It includes subfields for location code and text, aiding in patient tracking.

fields.name: location_code
fields.description: The 'location_code' field provides a coded representation of the patient's location within the emergency department. It is used for efficient tracking and management of patient flow.

fields.name: location_text
fields.description: The 'location_text' field offers a textual description of the patient's location within the emergency department. It complements the location code by providing a human-readable explanation.

fields.name: reserved_room
fields.description: The 'reserved_room' field contains details about any room reserved for the patient in the emergency department. It includes subfields for room code and text, aiding in resource planning and patient management.

fields.name: room_code
fields.description: The 'room_code' field provides a coded representation of the reserved room for the patient in the emergency department. It is used for efficient room management and patient tracking.

fields.name: room_text
fields.description: The 'room_text' field offers a textual description of the reserved room for the patient in the emergency department. It complements the room code by providing a human-readable explanation.

fields.name: edm_transport
fields.description: The 'edm_transport' field captures details about the transportation of the patient to or from the emergency department. It includes subfields for transport company and ID, aiding in logistics and coordination.

fields.name: transport_company_code
fields.description: The 'transport_company_code' field provides a coded representation of the transport company involved in the patient's transfer to or from the emergency department. It is used for logistics and coordination.

fields.name: transport_company_display
fields.description: The 'transport_company_display' field offers a display-friendly version of the transport company involved in the patient's transfer. It is used in user interfaces and reports for easy interpretation.

fields.name: transport_id_code
fields.description: The 'transport_id_code' field provides a coded representation of the transport ID associated with the patient's transfer to or from the emergency department. It is used for tracking and coordination.

fields.name: transport_id_display
fields.description: The 'transport_id_display' field offers a display-friendly version of the transport ID associated with the patient's transfer. It is used in user interfaces and reports for easy interpretation.

fields.name: transport_call_date_time
fields.description: The 'transport_call_date_time' field captures the date and time when the transport was called for the patient's transfer to or from the emergency department. It is crucial for logistics and coordination.

name: registration_query
description: The 'registration_query' field represents a collection of queries related to the patient's registration process. It includes subfields for mnemonic, question, and response, capturing essential registration details.

fields.name: mnemonic
fields.description: The 'mnemonic' field provides a shorthand or code used to identify a specific registration query. It aids in efficient data entry and retrieval during the registration process.

fields.name: question
fields.description: The 'question' field captures the specific question asked during the patient's registration process. It is essential for gathering accurate and relevant information from the patient.

fields.name: response
fields.description: The 'response' field records the patient's answer to a specific registration question. It is crucial for ensuring accurate documentation and facilitating the registration process.

name: insert_timestamp
description: The 'insert_timestamp' field captures the exact date and time when the encounter record was inserted into the system. It is essential for data integrity, audit trails, and tracking updates to the record.
